terms.label: VUS
terms.name: Unknown Significance
terms.description: Variant of unknown significance

terms.label: KP
terms.name: Known pathogenic
terms.description: Known pathogenic, previously known pathogenic in ClinVar, HGMD, literature, etc

terms.label: P
terms.name: Pathogenic
terms.description: Pathogenic, novel mutation but overlapping phenotype with known pathogenic, no further experimental validation needed

terms.label: NVP
terms.name: Novel validated pathogenic
terms.description: Novel validated pathogenic, novel mutation and validated experimentally

terms.label: PPP
terms.name: Pathogenic partial phenotype
terms.description: Pathogenic partial phenotype, pathogenic variant explains part of patients phenotype, but not all symptoms

terms.label: LP
terms.name: Likely pathogenic
terms.description: Likely pathogenic, experimental validation required to prove causality

terms.label: PP
terms.name: Possibly pathogenic
terms.description: Possibly pathogenic, uncertain significance, but cannot disregard yet

terms.label: LB
terms.name: Likely benign
terms.description: Likely benign, uncertain significance, but can discard

terms.label: B
terms.name: Benign
terms.description: Benign, does not cause phenotype

terms.label: O
terms.name: Other
terms.description: Other, phenotype not related to disease

terms.label: Common public
terms.description: Too common in public databases.

terms.label: Common local
terms.description: Too common in local databases.

terms.label: Irrelevant phenotype
terms.description: Phenotype not relevant.

terms.label: Inconsistent inheritance pattern
terms.description: Inheritance pattern not relevant.

terms.label: No plausible compound
terms.description: No plausible compound - AR disease.

terms.label: Not in disease transcript
terms.description: Not in transcript relevant to disease.

terms.label: Not in RefSeq transcript
terms.description: Not in a RefSeq transcript - could not be determined relevant.

terms.label: Splicing unaffected
terms.description: Does not appear to affect splicing.

terms.label: Inherited from unaffected
terms.description: Inherited from an unaffected individual.

terms.label: Technical issues
terms.description: Technical issues - likely false positive.

terms.label: No protein function
terms.description: Not likely to alter protein function - eg benign polyQ expansion.

terms.label: Reputation benign
terms.description: Reputable source classified benign.

terms.label: Common variation type
terms.description: Found in a gene with much benign such (e.g. missense) variation.

terms.label: Unstudied variation type
terms.description: In a gene where mainly other types of variation (e.g. repeat expansion) are established as pathologic.

terms.label: Possible Germline
terms.description: Variant is possibly a germline event.

terms.label: Low count normal
terms.description: Variant has too few reads in normal sample 'AD'.

terms.label: Low count tumor
terms.description: Variant has too few reads in tumor sample. 'AD'.

terms.label: Suspected in parent
terms.description: Variant is suspected to be mosaic in a parent sample.

terms.label: Suspected in affected
terms.description: Variant is suspected to be mosaic in a affected sample.

terms.label: Confirmed in parent
terms.description: Variant is confirmed to be mosaic in a parent sample.

terms.label: Confirmed in affected
terms.description: Variant is confirmed to be mosaic in a affected sample.

terms.label: Not evident in parental reads
terms.description: Variant was inspected for mosaicism, but not seen in reads from parental samples.

terms.label: Tier IA
terms.description: Strong Clinical Significance. Biomarkers in FDA or guidlines that predict response, resistance to therapy, diagnosis or prognosis to specific tumor type.

terms.label: Tier IB
terms.description: Potential Clinical Significance Biomarkers in well-powered, concenus affirmed studies that predict response, resistance to therapy, diagnostic or prognostic significance to specific tumor type.

terms.label: Tier IIC
terms.description: Biomarkers in FDA or guidlines that predict response, resistance to therapy,to a different tumor type; are diagnostic or prognostic for multiple small studies; or serve as study inclusion criteria.

terms.label: Tier IID
terms.description: Biomarkers that show plausible therapeutic significance based on preclinical studies, may assist diagnosis or prognosis based on small reports.

terms.label: Tier III
terms.description: Variant of Unknown Clinical Significance-Not observed in the population, nor in tumor databases.No convincing published evidence of cancer association.

terms.label: Tier IV
terms.description: Observed at high frequency in the population. No published evidence.
